name: Red Jacket Mountain View Resort

reviews.text: The Red Jacket is a unique hotel in that it truly is geared to kids, which is great. I agree about the water park, you literally have to give them tons of credit for running a safe, highly monitored, clean water park. There was constant supervision of everyone, which gives you a high level of comfort. The staff was great in dealing with kids and also dealing with the melt downs that come along with having young kids. Thats the beauty of this place, many, many people have kids of all ages so you don't have to feel that "guilt" when you kid is well, not acting like the prince that they should.
reviews.title: three toddlers and us.. our first overnight experience

reviews.text: The rooms are well, motor lodge-ish with some nice touches but don't expect to have a Westin or Ritz type of room (or bed) and for this type of situation you wouldn't want it.. you would be so concerned with what your kid is doing to the room you wouldn't be able to relax.. The views from the dining areas are stunning and also from the rooms (we had mountain view). We didn't book a package and booked late so I paid a premium for the room but it was worth it.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: We will be back probably this winter with the kids. don't let me kid you, my husband and I needed a vacation from our vacation and a massage when we got home. 3 toddlers and the red jacket amenities did us in!
reviews.title: Great Resort Experience

reviews.text: We stayed there for two nights in a condo with another couple. There was plenty of room. The amenities were well worth the price. It was located perfectly to get anywhere. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Great family experience!

reviews.text: We just stayed at Red Jacket for the first time this past weekend. We have stayed at a few different properties in the White Mountains over the years and we have loved all of them but RJ Mountain View was truly a resort experience. So much for the kids to do and the water park, arcade and arcade were big hits. the breakfast buffets were awesome. The mountain views were spectacular. We will be back for a weekend this fall.
reviews.title: Story Land Visit

reviews.text: My family just returned from a July 4th long weekend at the Red Jacket Mountainview Resort - our second stay this year. Once again, we had a truly wonderful experience. While it is true that the rooms are not brand-spanking new, they are clean and comfortable. We find the beds to be especially comfortable. We just take into consideration that this is a very well-used family resort with lots of young kids abusing the furniture :-) We stayed in a loft room, which while right next to the restauraunt and the stairs, was very quiet with a lovely mountain view. What really sets this place apart is the friendliness of the staff. Smiles, helpfulness and greetings wherever you turn. (The homebaked cookies help, too!!). We used the water park and pool - a lot - and had to peel our 9 year old son away from the water slides on our last day. Can't wait to come back!
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay at the RJMV

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a Caravan tour of New England and while all of the hotels Caravan uses are very nice the same offers for the breakfast buffet get boring. The Red Jacket offered eggs Benedict , an omelette station and a real treat, waffles with strawberries and fresh whipped cream! The food was fantastic and the service was quick and friendly! What a nice treat!
reviews.title: The best breakfast of the whole tour!

reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Red Jacket during 4th of July week. We had planned to stay for two nights but added a night because there was more we wanted to do in the area (will do separate reviews for Cranmore Mountain Adventure Park, Red Parka Pub, Conway Scenic Railroad, Bagels Plus, Stairway Café and Kahuna Laguna). With very few exceptions the front desk staff was very accommodating, friendly and enthusiastic. They had a great way of engaging kids of all ages including my sometimes not so outgoing teenaged son. They had something fun to say or share every time we passed through the lobby. They seemed to genuinely enjoy working there so keep up the great work management / ownership!
reviews.title: Great time, even with older kids.

reviews.text: We had a couple of minor issues that I mention below for other travelers to be aware of in case these things matter to them. The overall rating for this hotel was not impacted by these experiences - we really did have a great time and will be back!
reviews.title: The place has gone downhill...

reviews.text: Our room was great - with a loft for the kids. It was bright, spacious and clean (other than a pair of underwear my son found under his bed - not ours). We had a refrigerator which came in handy as well. I'd love to see them add small microwaves, but lack thereof didn't impact our experience or this review.
reviews.title: Great staff, very accomodating

reviews.text: This was our first trip to a Red Jacket and we loved it. The kids loved their loft beds in suite. Everything was clean and for the most part well kept. Obviously the kids loved the water park. I loved the breakfast buffet, one of the best I've ever had. If i had to nitpick the shower hot water was inconsistent and hard to control. And unfortunately the weather canceled the nightly horse wagon rides and bonfire. Pool also could have been a little bit warmer. Again though, these are minor nitpicks on a great stay. We may be back again next year.
reviews.title: Perfect family stay

reviews.text: We returned to the RJMV after 5 years. We used to go here when the kids were little. Thought we'd return for a trip down memory lane. To begin with they upgraded our room to mountain view with a balcony. VERY nice. The room was modern (remodeled?) and very clean. We were put at the end of a long, long hall, which kept us away from screaming kids nearer to the waterpark. don't know if that was intentional. Free newspaper was nice as well. Staff were friendly and professional. We did not use the indoor park. The outdoor pool is nice. We did not eat in either restaurant because of the prices.
reviews.title: a couple things keep it from excellence

reviews.text: And those couple things:
reviews.title: Nothing Special

reviews.text: the hallway outside our room smelled like dirty feet. I have to wonder when was the last time the
reviews.title: PERFECT Family Vacation

reviews.text: rugs were completely cleaned.
reviews.title: Not worth the $$$

reviews.text: we just got back with 8 yr old grandaughter. She cant get enough of waterpark. We tried out the Mt Cranmore goodtime! Champneys buffets awesome. Had breakfast buffet everyday even tried the dinner italian buffet great as well. Staff very friendly and accomodating. Stayed in the loft room pretty neat. Only issue we had was phone jack had to be held in phone to get a dial tone to call desk. May need to update that 338. Great as usual. Will be back in the fall!
reviews.title: excellent vaca with some family

reviews.text: First time staying at RJMV My boys 12 and 14 were a bit old for kahuna laguna but we all did enjoy the water slides and wave pool, nonetheless. The resort is also close to Monkey Trunks and very close Mt. Cranmore, and we fit those activities in, too. I was impressed with how friendly the staff was, always making it a point to greet us and proactively finding ways to be helpful. We were also very impressed with the quality of the food, particularly brunch. The hotel itself seems a bit dark and style-dated but the room was very clean and well maintained, and the a/c more than kept up with the heatwave. Wireless access worked well also. I wish we had stayed another day to explore the little touristy shops and restaurants just up the street where we had spied a playground with a frogpond with water sprinklers being enjoyed by toddlers - i wish i had brought my boys here when they were small! The staff and layout make everything at RJMV is so convenient for parents - we can actually relax and enjoy the kids! And the view from our mountain view room was spectacular!
reviews.title: Excellent family vacation spot!

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here 714-16. The rooms need an update, the Internet is extremely slow, and the rates are just too high. Top that off with hidden resort fees and unadvertised charges for their waterpark. I travel frequently for work and several times per year with my family and I will be taking my business elsewhere.
reviews.title: Cannot recommend....

reviews.text: We just came back from RedJacket Resort at North Conway, N.H. on our family vacation.
reviews.title: Awesome vacation
Great place for a family vacation
reviews.text: It was our grand-daughter's 4th birthday and what a birthday it was! Steve and Kellie made it very special for her. They found us out by the pool celebrating her birthday and brought her a special gift and even had a gift for her little sister. We even got a great picture with them.

description: New in 2013: Four Bedroom homes with full kitchens and decks that are walkable to all our amenities! We are located on 40 acres overlooking the Moat Mountain Range and Saco Valley and nestled in the heart of the Mount Washington Valley. Deluxe accommodations include romantic Jacuzzi rooms or spacious family lofts, Alvoces and our newly renovated 2 bedrooms townhouses. You'll enjoy spectacular mountain views from your own private balcony or patio. Personal service is the hallmark of our commitment to you. Our front desk is at your service for all the arrangements you will need for activities such as hiking, fishing, skiing, canoeing, sightseeing, the outlets of North Conway and StoryLand. Pet Friendly.
